title: Tiffany Wu
text:
Welcome! I am a doctoral student in the Combined Program in Education and Psychology (CPEP) at the University of Michigan and am pursuing a dual master's degree in Statistics. I am also an IES Causal Inference Predoctoral Fellow and a 2022 APPAM Equity and Diversity Fellow.
At the University of Michigan, I work with Dr. Christina Weiland. I am broadly interested in examining education interventions and policies through research-practice partnerships, using causal inference and machine learning methods. I hope to apply this research to inform the development of more effective and equitable education interventions and teaching policies. I worked as a public high school teacher in Chicago and then as a research analyst for an education non-profit prior to starting my PhD. In my free time, I likes to paint, play the piano, and rock climb.


M.A. in Psychology | University of Chicago | 2019
B.S. in Secondary Education & History | Northwestern University | 2015

title: Research
text:
Causal inference
Machine learning
Psychometrics
Executive functioning
Early childhood education
Education equity

title: Rtistry
text:
People have referred to art that is created by coding in the R statistical programming language as “Rtistry” or “aRt”. I love merging my love of art with the technical framework of code, and I think the artistic exploration of code can open the door to beautiful, new visualizations (and better coding skills!).
Here you’ll find a selection of Rtistry pieces I’ve created. I’ve provided code for some of the piece on my Github page, so feel free to take a look if you’re interested!



Inspired by a map of my mom’s hometown in Chiayi, Taiwan





Inspired by Haku in Sprited Away





Some soot sprites





Inspired by Ponyo





More Spirited Away-inspired aRt
